segments.text: It's 6 AM and I hiked up to the ridge to catch sunrise. Totally worth the early wake-up.
The sky is just starting to turn pink on the eastern horizon. The peaks are silhouetted against it.
Temperature's brutal though. My hands are freezing even with gloves. Maybe minus 8 or 9 degrees.
But this light... this is why landscape photographers get up at ridiculous hours. The colors are unreal.
I can see four different mountain ranges from up here. Layer after layer fading into the distance.
The nearest peaks are sharp and defined, then they get hazier and bluer the farther out you look.
Oh! The sun just broke the horizon. Golden light is hitting the highest peaks now.
The snow is glowing orange and pink. I'm taking photos but I know they won't capture what I'm seeing.
Some moments you just have to experience. Lock them in your memory because no camera can do them justice.
There's not a cloud in the sky. Just pure, clear alpine air and this incredible light show.
I'm completely alone up here. No one else for kilometers. Just me and this sunrise.
This is what freedom feels like. Standing on a mountain ridge at sunrise, accountable to no one.
The light's changing fast now. The pink is turning to gold, the shadows are shrinking.
I should head back to camp soon. Make breakfast, plan today's route. But I want to stay just a few more minutes.
Days like this remind me why I work so hard. So I can afford these trips. So I can feel this alive.

environment.background_sounds: wind, camera shutter clicks, boots on rock
